descriptions.content: Examples: གང་​​བྱུང་​​མང་​​བྱུང་ “anyhow”, ཐ་​​རེ་​​ཐོ་​​རེ་ “scatty, piecemeal”, ཚ་​​གེ་​​ཚི་​​གེ་ “nervous, shaky”, ཚབ་​​བེ་​​ཚུབ་​​བེ་ “hastily”

Tibetan contains a number of adjectival and adverbial expressions consisting of four syllables. The general pattern is that the first syllable is phonologically associated with the third, whereas the second is linked to the fourth, according to the pattern: (X)(Y1)(X)(Y2).

Here are a few very common expressions:

  • གང་བྱུང་མང་བྱུང་ “Anyhow”
  • ཐ་རེ་ཐོ་རེ་ “Scatty,” “piecemeal”
  • ཚ་གེ་ཚི་གེ་ “Nervous,” “shaky”
  • ཚབ་བེ་ཚུབ་བེ་ “Hastily”
  • ཛ་རེ་ཛོ་རེ་ “Messy”
